Guide to the J.W. Huntting copy of records of the First Church of Christ, Southold, Long Island 1973.182
Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

English Describing Archives: A Content Standard
J.W. Huntting copy of records of the First Church of Christ, Southold, Long Island 1973.182
Brooklyn Historical Society
A0007
0.1 Linear feet in one folder.
1694-1853
Huntting, J. W.
Scope and Contents note
One bound volume containing a handwritten copy of the records of the First Church of Christ in Southold, Long Island, for the period 1694 to 1853. The volume includes lists of baptisms, communions, covenants, deaths, and marriages, along with references to free and enslaved African Americans. An index of family names covered in the records is also included. The copy was created by J.W. Huntting in 1858.
Historical Note
The First Church of Christ in Southold, Long Island was founded in 1640 as a Presbyterian congregation under the leadership of the Reverend John Younges (Youngs) of Southwold, England. As of 2011, the church continues to serve the Southold community under the name of the First Presbyterian Church of Southold.
Source:
First Presbyterian Church of Southold. "Since 1640 ... A Brief History of the Church." Accessed April 14, 2011. http://www.fpcsouthold.org/
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition note
The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); J.W. Huntting copy of records of the First Church of Christ, Southold, Long Island, 1973.182, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
